intro: Cibotium barometz, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a member of the Dicksoniaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of fronds that can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Cibotium barometz plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
